author.persName:
بلغرامی، غلام علی حسينی وسيطی
آزاد

msItem.title: Sarw-i Azad
msItem.note: First folio, recto: a) Presented to the Oriental Translation Comm by Sir A Malet b) Impression of small oblong rectangular seal of Muhammad Mu'azzam Khan dated A.H. 1178. Front flyleaf, recto. a) Note in Persian noting that the book is the possession of Ihtisham al-Daulah Bahadur Nasir al-Mulk Mistir Charls War Malit Firuz-Jang. b) In large script Sir Charls War Malit Barunit. c) impression of small oblong rectangular seal of ? dated 1175[?]. Final folio, verso, notes probably in Hindustani. Pasted on front cover: paper slip with correct title and author's name in Persian. An anthology with notices of Persian poets who wrote in or visited India and of poets writing in 'Hindi'. A continuation of the same author's Ma'athir al-Kiram Tarikh-i Bilgram. Headings and punctuation in red.
msItem.incipit: Sarmayah-i hamd-i niyaz-i mubdi'i kih arwah-i ma'ani-ra

bindingDesc.p: Limp brown leather binding, presumably Indian with blind-stamped decoration.

origin.p: Undated but must be earlier than most MSS listed by Storey.

acquisition.p: Presented to the Oriental Translation Committee by Sir A. Malet. (The handwritten catalogue is wrong to note it as one of Sir John Malcolm's MSS.)

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: Persian and Hindustani poets and poetry, 16th to 18th centuries.
